data.title: Ubuntu Installation Not Installing Launcher Icon Pack
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install VSCode on Ubuntu via .deb file from https://code.visualstudio.com/
2. Notice that the Launcher icon is missing.

Some notes:
- /usr/share/icons/ does not include an icon pack for VSCode.
- The solution to copy an image to /usr/share/icons/ does not apply the Launcher icon.
- The solution to create a code.desktop file and placing it in ~/.local/share/applications/ with a corresponding image does not work.

My solution was to place a .png icon in /usr/share/icons/ and update the Applications properties icon to point to that image.

I am not extremely familiar with how the application is being built or installed, but I thought I'd bring this to attention.

Thanks!

data.title: Provide a way to manually reload an opened file
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.8.1
- OS Version:Windows 7 64 bit

I am trying to analyze the log files. It would be very helpful if i have a feature like a button click or a command to reload a file from disk. I can see the file being reloaded automatically but i am expecting a command to reload the file manually/only when needed. 

Any suggestion or help on this feature please?

Thanks,
Jai.

data.title: Cmd-G should work in Explorer
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Search for something
2. Hit Cmd-Shift-E to activate explorer
3. Hit Cmd-G
4. Nothing happens

Cmd-F still works.

I found this out when I was looking for something in some specific files. I clicked on the file, hit Cmd-G and expected matches in that file to be highlighted.

if I have to use another file of the folder then I have to open the folder manually or I have to drag a file inside. I request to open the folder automatically as atom does. its easier to work.

data.title: Indentation detection doesn't work with 3-spaces

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: any

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set the following settings:
```json
{
   "editor.tabSize": 3,
   "editor.insertSpaces": true,
   "editor.detectIndentation": true
}
```
2. Open source file that uses 3-space indentation
3. Notice guessed indentation is not 3-spaces (typically guesses 4)

After attempting to debug this it became clear pretty quickly. The `indentationGuesser` is designed to work with [2, 4, 6, and 8 spaces](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/1.8.1/src/vs/editor/common/model/indentationGuesser.ts#L90).

So is it feasible to make the indentation guesser work with odd-number space indentation? If not there should probably be something somewhere to tell you the indent detection only works with 2, 4, 6, 8 spaces.

data.title: Add support for additional global config files (in addition to settings.json)
data.body:
It would be very helpful for somebody attempting to sync config files between multiple machines if VSCode supported some system for having multiple config files included at a time.

### Benefits:

Imagine a config folder structure like this on a developer's mac:
```
- settings.json -> ~/Drive/dotfiles/settings.json
- settings.local.json -> ~/Drive/dotfiles/settings.my-mac.json
```

And then like this on a developer's linux desktop:
```
- settings.json -> ~/Drive/dotfiles/settings.json
- settings.local.json -> ~/Drive/dotfiles/settings.my-arch.json
```

Using symlinks, then, a developer would be able to have specialized configuration files for each computer, while keeping the vast majority of options synced between both.

### Implementation:

I can think of two simple ways to implement this with as little friction as possible.

1) An `editor.includeConfig` option in the main `settings.json` 
This might be a JSON array, with support for various different config files. It could also just be a single field. 
Whether or not the option should be recursive is up to the VSCode team.
2) VSCode searches for all config files in the directory matching `settings[.foo].json` and includes those.

### Conflicts:
If going with option (1) above, conflicting config entries should take precedence the later they appear in the `includeConfig` array.

If going with option (2), the main `settings.json` file should take precendence.

data.title: How to add a new action to the editor that replaces editor content and maintains Undo stack ?

When I call 'setValue' or 'setModel' actions of the monaco editor the text is replaced yet undo stack is destroyed and I cannot undo this action.

Any help is greatly appreciated. Thanks.

- if references a browser support property or other external, please resolve by design

data.title: Next/Prev Group circles through existing groups
data.body:
Proposal for #12833.

Next/Prev Group actions circle through existing groups without creating new ones. Similar to behavior in Sublime and Atom.
Fixes the issue when the user is at the last group and NextGroup action does nothing. Same for first group and PreviousGroup action.

data.title: Output (tasks) pane doesn't autoscroll
data.body:
- VSCode Version: `1.9.0-insider` 04f541160e0d41be95df9a964b1b570aec549157
- OS Version: macOS Sierra `10.12.2`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Setup a build task ('m using a powershell script)
2. Open the output pane to `tasks`
3. Trigger a build (I used the hotkey)
4. The tasks pane will clear, but won't autoscroll

I've had the same issue with a `watch` command (also powershell) but the difference there is that it doesn't clear the pane first -- but I would still expect it to autoscroll as long as I haven't scrolled up, and if I have, then it should resume auto-scrolling if I scroll all the way back down.

//cc @isidorn

data.title: Auto-close brackets before commas
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z) + 1.9.0 latest Insiders build
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

### Disclaimer

I tried to find similar issues, but couldn't. I'm sorry if this issue already exists.

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create TS document
2. Create multiple cursors after `=` before semi
3. Press <kbd>[</kbd>

### Expected behavoiur:

All brackets must be closed.

### Actual behaviour:

Only the last pair of brackets will be closed.

```ts
private makeSymbols(variables: IVariable[]=, mixins: IMixin[]=, imports: IImport[]=): ISymbols {
	return {
		variables,
		mixins,
		imports
	};
}
```

![2016-12-20_22-23-34](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/21364701/fa435b0a-c702-11e6-907c-6f286fc2b238.gif)

data.title: Fix for #12833.
data.body: Next/Prev groups now circle when you reach the last/first position.

data.title: parameterHints text blurs on scroll when editor zoom level is non-default
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.7.2|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Zoom out from default/reset zoom level (Ctrl + -)
2. In a .psm1 PowerShell file, type a command, begin typing an argument with a hyphen (eg: Write-host -)
3. The suggestion box will show, scroll down any amount and observe the text is no longer sharp but is now blurry
![vscode suggestion box normal](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6895337/21362769/9aa0cd18-c69e-11e6-9114-703f7ad0c798.png)
![vscode suggestion box blurry](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6895337/21362768/9a996474-c69e-11e6-83e9-7f7191855a51.png)

data.title: Read only/read write indicator in status bar
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Window 7 Professional

Request to add a RW/RO indicator to right side of the status bar. Clicking on the indicator could offer the option to change the status of the file disk. If accepted would read/write status of file on disk, if declined would just allow the file to be edited. Similar to SlickEdit.
Similar is already implemented in extension https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=alefragnani.read-only-indicator, but appears on the left and isn't built in as standard.

data.title: Add OS-specific dependency PATHs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1

I develop on Ubuntu 16 and Windows 10 interchangeably, and my paths to Node, PHP, and others differ on each platform. I'd like to add OS-specific paths in my settings.json since I synchronise my user settings across each platform via Dropbox.

Something like this would be useful:
```json
"paths": {
    "linux": [],
    "osx": [],
    "windows": [
        "C:/Program Files (x86)/PHP/php-5.4/"
    ]
}
```

data.title: problem with baseUrl when enableDefaultLanguageUrlCode=true
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. set enableDefaultLanguageUrlCode=true
2. set baseUrl= https://domain.com
3. Yii::$app->urlManager->createUrl(['site/index']);

Result: https://domain.comhttps//domain.com/en-us
Expected: https://domain.com/en-us

data.title: Isidorn/tabs in editor group service
data.body:
Tested it out and works nicely. Things which are not very nice and would like to get feedback:

- Naming of methods in `groupService.ts`, notice that the setting is named `showTabs` so I was trying to be consistent with that
- Currently the `editorGroupService` does not react on `showTabs` changed in the configuration - the `PartService` does that and lets the `editorGroupService` know. The alternative would be the `editorGroupService` does this but then needs to check the part service if zen mode is active (which would require an additional method in part service)

Fixes #17207
